name: CT Colorectal Cancer Baseline Staging - Oncology Findings

attributes.name: Primary tumor location
attributes.description: Please choose one or multiple contiguous locations if there is one tumor and more than one location if there are multiple primary tumors.

values.name: no definite residual tumor at the site of endoscopic resection and biopsy
upper rectum
values.description: Intraperitoneal rectum (rectum above the anterior peritoneal reflection to sigmoid take off)

values.name: lower rectum
values.description: Extraperitoneal rectum (below the anterior peritoneal reflection and above the anorectal ring)

values.name: mid rectum
values.description: Section of rectum bridging the anterior peritoneal reflection

values.name: anal canal
values.description: Anal verge to the top of anorectal ring.  Added this to accommodate the extension of lower rectal tumor to the level below the anorectal ring.

attributes.name: Primary Tumor Morphology
attributes.description: Does the tumor show annular constricting morphology or involves small circumference of the lumen or is the tumor polypoid?

attributes.name: Primary tumor  extramural venous involvement
attributes.description: If present, please add where it is seen, series number and image number

values.name: absent
values.description: not seen

attributes.name: Locoregional (draining) lymph nodes overall status
attributes.description: Please evaluate all the lymph nodes along the draining lymphatics and veins to the level of inferior mesenteric vein for the tumors draining into inferior mesenteric pathways, or to the superior mesenteric vein for the tumors draining into inferior mesenteric pathways. In addition, please evaluate the pelvic side wall (obturator/internal iliac) lymph nodes for low rectal tumors.

attributes.name: Suspicious and biopsy proven nodes
attributes.description:
List all the levels of suspicious, highly suspicious and biopsy proven malignant lymph nodes along the draining lymphatics and veins to the level of inferior mesenteric vein for the tumors draining into inferior mesenteric pathways, or to the superior mesenteric vein for the tumors draining into inferior mesenteric pathways. In addition, please evaluate the pelvic side wall (obturator/internal iliac) lymph nodes for low rectal tumors. 

Ideally requires same subheadings for each choice as "L...

values.name: absent
values.description: not seen

values.name: perirectal lymph nodes
values.description: Nodes outside the region enveloped by mesorectal fascia or when mesorectal fascia is not well seen on CT

attributes.name: Indeterminate lymph nodes
attributes.description: List all the levels of indeterminate lymph nodes along the draining lymphatics and veins to the level of inferior mesenteric vein for the tumors draining into inferior mesenteric pathways, or to the superior mesenteric vein for the tumors draining into inferior mesenteric pathways. In addition, please evaluate the pelvic side wall (obturator/internal iliac) lymph nodes for low rectal tumors.

values.name: perirectal node
values.description: nodes outside the region enveloped by mesorectal fascia or when mesorectal fascia is not well seen on CT

attributes.name: Metastatic disease overall status
attributes.description:
Please provide an overall summary after evaluation of all common metastatic sites.
Please list all sites of indeterminate but possibly benign lesions seen (e.g. lung nodules and cystic/atypical liver lesions that need to be assessed on follow up imaging to ensure stability)

values.name: Indeterminate
values.description: Possibly (~50% probability of malignancy)

values.name: Suspicious
values.description: Suspicious  (~75% probability of malignancy)

values.name: Highly suspicious for malignancy
values.description: Consistent with (>90% probability of malignancy)

attributes.name: Metastatic sites
attributes.description:
Please select all metastatic sites that are highly suspicious for malignancy/frankly malignant/ biopsy proven.
Please provide additional descriptions of all or any of these sites in the free text as needed.

values.name: non regional lymph nodes in the abdomen and pelvis
intrathoracic lymph nodes
values.description: .g. Hilar or mediastinal or anterior diaphragmatic or internal mammary chain lymph nodes. Specific location of intrathoracic lymph node can be added in the free text.

attributes.name: Metastatic sites - indeterminate
attributes.description: Describe all lesions that are indeterminate for metastases. Ex. Tiny lung nodules, tiny liver lesions that are difficult to characterize at baseline.

values.name: non regional lymph nodes in the abdomen and pelvis
intrathoracic lymph nodes
values.description: Added the following definition for Intrathoracic lymph nodes  " e.g. Hilar or mediastinal or anterior diaphragmatic or internal mammary chain lymph nodes. Specific location of intrathoracic lymph node can be added in the free text."

values.name: other organ
values.description: Please list any additional organs involved in free text

attributes.name: Number of metastases
attributes.description: Number of metastases in all sites

values.name: counting not possible due to peritoneal carcinomatosis
counting not possible due to diffuse pleural involvement

attributes.name: Number of sites involved by metastatic disease
attributes.description: Add one for each involved site (only include suspicious, highly suspicious and biopsy proven sites). exclude indeterminate sites and their status should d be determined on follow up imaging.

attributes.name: Size of representative sites of disease 1
attributes.description:
Ideally we need a table for measurement of up to 5-10 lesions

This can be copied and pasted as need for 5-10 lesions

attributes.name: Location of representative lesion 1
attributes.description:
Please add series number and image number in free text
Consider adding any relevant vascular relationships of this lesion in free text

values.name: peritoneum
values.description: Ideally not measured. Only measured when borders are clearly defined

values.name: non regional lymph nodes in the abdomen and pelvis
values.description: e.g. retroperitoneal nodes or iliac chain nodes in colorectal cancer, inguinal nodes in high rectal cancer

values.name: intrathoracic lymph node
values.description: e.g. Hilar or mediastinal or anterior diaphragmatic or internal mammary chain lymph nodes. Specific location of intrathoracic lymph node can be added in the free text.

values.name: other organ
values.description: Specify the other organ involved in free text
